BR_text.BRsummary: Regression: datepicker is broken when date is Epoch
BR_text.BRdescription:
The first date input in e2e/scripts/st_sidebar.py is broken, but our screenshot tests didn't catch it since it's below the diff threshold 😢
 <denchmark-h:h3>Here's what it looks like right now</denchmark-h>
 
 Notice that the date picker is disabled, for some reason!
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/690814/85236309-d4537f00-b3d1-11ea-8f79-8672b7479386.png></denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Here's what it's supposed to look like</denchmark-h>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/streamlit/streamlit/develop/frontend/cypress/snapshots/linux/2x/st_sidebar.spec.ts/date-popover-sidebar.snap.png></denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>This is the code in question</denchmark-h>
 
 w1 = st.sidebar.date_input("Label 1", date(1970, 1, 1))
 st.write("Value 1:", w1)
 <denchmark-h:h3>Info</denchmark-h>
 
 Streamlit version: 0.62.0

comments_0.comment_text: The issue was due to the interpretation of the default min date 0001/01/01 being interpreted to be the year 2001. Change has been merged to ensure the date is always interpreted correctly.
